channel.title: Labs on Tianyi@Oxford
channel.description: Recent content in Labs on Tianyi@Oxford

item.title: Metabolic Modelling
item.description: 1 The Haldane Relationship 2 Control Points in A Simple Linear Pathway 3 Linear Pathway with Negative Feedback 3.1 Re-analyse the effect of \(K_i\) with constant flux 3.1.1 Repeat with Model 212 Model 112 was used. 1 The Haldane Relationship Using the “Parameter Scan” utility in Copasi (Figure 1.1), I collected steady state concentrations of ‘A’ and ‘B’ in \(5^4 = 625\) combinations of \(V_{max(f)}\), \(K_{m(p)}\), \(V_{max(r)}\), and \(K_{m(s)}\), where each parameter vary from \(1\times10^{-2}\) to \(1\times10^{2}\) in a logarithmic scale.

item.title: Gene Expression Practical Paper 6 Questions
item.description: (a) Assign each lac mutation to one of the strains 1 to 5. Explain your reasoning in each case. 1 2 3 4 5 WT glycerol + − + − − - glycerol+IPTG + − + + − + glucose+IPTG − − − + − - ×WT hybrid + glycerol IPTG IPTG + IPTG IPTG ×lacY− hybrid IPTG × Strain 1: lacI- Strain 2: lacZ- Strain 3: lacOc Strain 4: mutation that causes RNAP to bind more easily Strain 5: lacP- Strains 1 and 3 are both sensitive to catabolite repression (by glucose) but insensitive to induction by IPTG (transcription occurs as long as glucose is not present), which can be either due to lacI- or lacOc.

item.title: Gene Control Practical
item.description: 1 Determine the time course of \(\beta\)-galactosidase induction 1.1 Protocal 1.2 Results 2 Identify the WT Strain 2.1 Protocol 3 Devise an experimental protocol to show the role played by cAMP in catabolite repression. 3.1 Results (part 2 and 3) 4 Devise experiments to test the following model. 4.1 Protocol 4.2 Results 1 Determine the time course of \(\beta\)-galactosidase induction 1.1 Protocal Trial experiment: Take OD600 reading in spectrophotometer 1) to verify that the absorbance is around 0.

item.title: Computational Genomics Practical (TT 2020)
item.description: 1 Quiz 5 1.1 Heatmaps (using ggplot2 in R) 1.2 Heatmaps in Python (with seaborn) 1.3 Average Gene Profile 2 Quiz 8 2.1 Matlab 2.2 Using R 1 Quiz 5 1.1 Heatmaps (using ggplot2 in R) Loading Packages library(R.matlab) ## R.matlab v3.6.2 (2018-09-26) successfully loaded. See ?R.matlab for help. ## ## Attaching package: 'R.matlab' ## The following objects are masked from 'package:base': ## ## getOption, isOpen library(reshape2) library(tidyverse) ## ── Attaching packages ─────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse 1.

item.title: Immunoassay (in Silico)
item.description: 1 Aim of the Practical 2 Background Q1 3 Introduction to Radioimmunoassay 4 Radioimmunoassay Simulation — Tutorial (a) Choosing a suitable concentration of Ab (b) Testing effect of changing [Ab] at fixed [Ag] (d) Testing precision 5 RIA: Generating Your Own Data (a) Finding a suitable concentration of antibody (b) Generating the calibartion curve and (c) Finding the concentration of the unknown 6 Enzyme-Linked Immunosorbentassay (a) Background to ELISA (b) METHOD: ElisaLab 7 ELISA Tutorial 8 ELISA Experiment (a) Choosing a suitable concentration of antibody (b) Generating the calibration curve (c) Measuring concentration of the unknown 9 Supplementary Information 9.

item.title: Specific Radioactivity
item.description: Specific radioactivity of ATP and glucose.
